title.narrative: Pakistan Flood Emergency Cash Transfer Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the project is to support the recovery of flood affected households by assisting the Government of Pakistan (GoP) in strengthening the implementation of its Citizen's Damage Compensation Program (CDCP).

condition.narrative: Agreement that the responsibility for policy formulation and inter-institutional coordination of the project rests with CCI.
GOP shall carry out the Project in accordance with the Project Operations Manual.
GOP shall establish management information system (MIS) no later than three months after effective date.
GOP shall maintain NODMC as an advisory role to CCI, responsible for monitoring and evaluation of the performance of Component 1ofthe Project.
GOP shall maintain an emergency relief cell within the Cabinet Div., responsible for the carrying out of the technicalcoordinationand day-to-day impl. of Comp. 1 of the project.
GOP, donors and IDA have entered into MOU committing 60% of donors resources for the financing of cash transfers under CDCP.
GOP, participating provinces, and NADRA entered into Agency Agreements with the Participating Banks.
GOP, participating provinces, and NADRA shall enter into a tripartite agreement coordinating their roles and functions forComponent 1 no later than 3 mos. after effective date
NADRA sghall establish and easily accessible greivance redressal mechanism by no later than three moths after the Effective Date.
NADRA shall develop a public information campaign in coordination with the PDMAs, by no later than August 31, 2011 and thereaftercarry out the campaign throughout the Project.
NADRA shall develop a simplified Procurement Manual by no later than one month after the Effective Date.
NADRA shall engage by no later than May 30, 2011 the services of a consultancy firm to carry out the ex-post impact evaluation ofthe Project.
NADRA shall engage by no later than three months after the Effective Date the service of consultancy firm to carry out OperationalAudits of the Project.
NADRA shall establish an independent procurement complaint handling mechanism no later than one month after the Effective Date.
NADRA shall prepare the Project Operations Manual.
Operational Manual approved by GOP through an endorsement of either the Council of Common Interest or the respective provincialChief Secretaries
Qualified Financial Management staff employed at the Cabinet Division.
Time bound action plan for the development of a future disasters/emergency crisis through the provision of cash transfers,including appropriate mechanism for asset recovery

title.narrative: Program evaluated, and results report published.

comment.narrative: Rapid Evaluation of the CDCP phase I was finalized in March 2011.
The draft final impact evaluation report has been shared for comment and was discussed during the mission. The firm willincorporate these comments by March 31, 2014.

title.narrative: Targeting efficiency: Average baseline poverty score of CDCP II households will be lower than average baseline poverty scores of non CDCP families in each province.

comment.narrative: Targeting efficiency was calculated using the poverty score card database. The average PSC score for a CDCP -II beneficiary was19.27 while the average score for a non-beneficiary was 24.14 - a 25.3% difference (24.14-19.27) / 19.27.

title.narrative: At least 85% of families pick up cash grants within stipulated timelines.

comment.narrative: The great majority of recipients withdraw their complete payment immediately after their eligibility for Phase II is confirmed.

title.narrative: At least 70% of beneficiaries express satisfaction with the program delivery.

comment.narrative: There is no one question on overall satisfaction. However, the follow-up survey asks beneficiaries: Would you say your overallexperience with the payment process was? 77.5% of beneficiaries stated good or very good. As this is a cash transfer program theseanswers are used to determine general satisfaction with the program.

title.narrative: At least 1 million flood affected, eligible households as per the re-targeting criteria benefit from cash grants.
Operational Audit regularly carried out, and recommendations incorporated into program implementation.

comment.narrative: The Operational audit was in operation during the entire time there were field activities and grievances were being reviewed. Thefirm presented their final analysis and recommendations to the mission which will be incorporate into the implementation of theFDRAPgoing forward.

title.narrative: Functioning grievance mechanisms for re-targeting and payments established and accessible.

comment.narrative: All operating WATAN card centers have a grievance desk and staff have been trained on the procedures. Support from IOM to the DRCshas resulted in improved operations of the DRCs and better record keeping. The program has received 1,179,956 million appeals whichwere reviewed and resolved. 29% were accepted into the program.

title.narrative: Mechanism agreed and established to enable GOP to effectively respond to potential future disaster recovery.

comment.narrative: The action plan was approved by the Prime Minister. Several provincial workshops for dissemination have been held to raiseawareness. The CDCP model has been used as the blueprint for the 2011 and 2012 flood responses at the provincial level.

title.narrative: Public information campaign carried out as per the agreed communication strategy.

comment.narrative: NADRA has adopted the PIC, and is implementing it with support from IOM and others.

title.narrative: Management information system strengthened, as measured by MIS modules for targeting, enrolment etc. developed, MIS training provided, computer systems in place, etc. according to the project activity
